name: Pan-Fried Salmon Croquettes
author: adrianprince@yahoo.com
summary: When you feel like fish, you can enjoy these salmon croquettes from many of the ingredients already in your pantry.
ingredients: 3 (14.75 ounce) cans salmon, drained and flaked
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
¼ cup vegetable oil for frying, or as needed
directions: Combine salmon, eggs, and onion in a bowl
Season with cayenne and salt; mix well
Place fish fry in another bowl
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
While the oil heats, place a large spoonful of salmon in the palm of your hand and form an oval croquette patty
Place croquettes in the fish fry and flip over to coat
Working in batches, place croquettes in the hot oil and cook until edges have browned, about 5 minutes
Flip and cook the other side, about 5 minutes
Remove to a paper towel-lined platter and repeat to cook remaining batches
